net.sf.gogui.game
Class Node

java.lang.Object
  net.sf.gogui.game.Node
All Implemented Interfaces:
ConstNode
public final class Node
extends java.lang.Object
implements ConstNode

Node in a game tree. The memory requirement is optimized for nodes containing only a move and comment property (e.g. for GNU Go's large SGF traces). The optimization also expects that most nodes have only one child.

addSgfProperty

public void addSgfProperty(java.lang.String label,
                           java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> values)
Add other unspecified SGF property. Do not add SGF properties that can be set with other member functions. This is for preserving unknown SGF properties that are unknown to this program, or cannot be handled in all cases. Example: the OT property is handled only if the value string, whose format is not specified by the SGF standard, is in a known format used by some other programs. Otherwise it is should be put to the unknown SGF properties, so that the old value is preserved if no new value is set in GameInfo.

Parameters:
label - The name of the property
values - The values of the property

addSgfProperty

public void addSgfProperty(java.lang.String label,
                           java.lang.String value)

addStone

public void addStone(GoColor c,
                     GoPoint p)
Add or remove a setup stone. It is not checked, if this stone is already in the list of added or removed stones.

Parameters:
c - The color of the stone (Black or White; Empty for removal).
p - The location of the setup stone.

addStones

public void addStones(GoColor c,
                      ConstPointList list)
Add or remove a list of setup stones. It is not checked, if this stone is already in the list of added or removed stones.

Parameters:
c - The color of the stone (Black or White; Empty for removal).
list - The locations of the setup stones.

getToMove

public GoColor getToMove()
Get color to move. If a player is explicitely set, it is returned, otherwise if the node contains a move, the color of the move is returned.

The color to move or null if nothing is known about the color to move

sortSetup

public void sortSetup()
Sort the lists of setup stones (add stones and remove stones. Sorted lists for setup stones make it easier to compare, if two nodes have the same lists.
